title: Quiz 9: First Aid & Emergency Care
description: Assess knowledge of first aid aims, safety assessment, and emergency response priorities.

questions.question: What are the three key aims of First Aid (often called the 3 Ps)? (Select 3)
questions.explanation: The aims are to Preserve life, Prevent the condition from worsening, and Promote recovery.

questions.question: What is the very first thing a first aider should do upon arriving at an emergency scene?

options.text: Assess the situation and ensure safety

questions.explanation: Safety is the absolute priority. You cannot help if you become a casualty yourself.

questions.question: The 'ABC' of critical lifesaving stands for Airway, ___BLANK___, and Circulation.
Order the steps for proper hand washing:

items.text: Rub palms together and back of hands

questions.hint: Water first, then soap, then friction, then rinse.

questions.question: You should always move a casualty immediately to the hospital before assessing their injuries.
questions.explanation: False. You should generally treat a casualty in the position you find them unless they are in immediate danger. Moving them can cause further injury (e.g., spinal injury).
questions.hint: Moving a broken neck could be fatal.

questions.question: Why is it important to wear disposable gloves when giving first aid?
questions.explanation: Gloves protect both the first aider and the casualty from cross-contamination and blood-borne infections.
questions.hint: It protects against blood and germs.

questions.question: What number should you call for emergency help in the context of the study material (US standard often used)?
questions.explanation: The text references 911 as the emergency number.
questions.hint: It's the standard US emergency code.

questions.question: Match the First Aid Kit item with its use:
questions.explanation: Each item has a specific purpose in emergency care.
